duration_seconds.description:
Required lease duration in seconds.

Must be `<= max_duration_seconds` when `max_duration_seconds != 0`.

lessee.description:
Optional lessee address.

- If omitted, the zero address is used.
- If provided, `arbitrary_lessee_flat_fee` is added to the flat fee.

receiver_salt.description:
Optional receiver salt (bytes32 hex).

- If omitted, server selects an available salt.
- If provided, must exist in indexer `receiver_salt_candidates`.

target_chain_id.description:
Destination EVM chainId.

Must have a configured bridger route for `(target_chain_id,target_token)`.

target_token.description:
Target settlement token (EVM address on hub chain).

Must have a configured bridger route for `(target_chain_id,target_token)`.

nukeable_after.description: Unix timestamp after which the lease is nukeable, computed as `now + duration_seconds`.

receiver_salt.description: Receiver salt selected/used for the lease (bytes32 hex).

origin_id.description: Origin identifier (txId for pre-entitle, receiver_salt for receiver pull, etc.)

origin_raw_amount.description: Raw amount before fees (uint256, decimal string).

origin_token.description: Origin token/address (string; Tron token for receiver pull; zero address otherwise).

LeaseViewResponse.description:
Realtor-side aggregated view of a lease in the Untron V3 protocol.

This response is designed to be stable for clients:
- Uint256-like values are returned as decimal strings.
- Source-of-truth data comes from the indexer API (PostgREST views).

claims.description: Claims emitted by this lease (current state per claim_id).

is_owned_by_this_realtor.description: Whether this lease was created by this realtor service instance.

lease_nonce.description: Current per-lease nonce used for payout config signatures (uint256, decimal string).

lessee.description: Current lessee (EVM address) that controls payout config updates.

nukeable_after.description: Earliest timestamp when the lease is nukeable (unix seconds).

payout_config_history.description: Payout config history (KV versions ordered by valid_from_seq).

realtor.description: Realtor (EVM address) that created this lease.

receiver_address_evm.description:
Receiver address in EVM hex form (0x...).

This is the 20-byte address corresponding to the Tron receiver address.

receiver_address_tron.description:
Receiver address on Tron (base58check, T...).

Derived from `receiver_salt` using the controller's deterministic receiver scheme.

start_time.description: Lease start time on hub chain (unix seconds).

NumericValue.description: Numeric value represented as a JSON number.

allowed.description:
Whether this realtor is allowlisted on the hub.

When false, `POST /realtor` returns `403`.

arbitrary_lessee_flat_fee.description: Additional flat fee added when a non-null `lessee` is provided in `POST /realtor`.

default_duration_seconds.description: Default duration seconds from this service's env (used only to compute effective_duration_seconds).

default_fee_ppm.description: Default lease fee PPM from this service's env.

default_flat_fee.description: Default flat fee from this service's env (before min and adders).

effective_duration_seconds.description:
Effective duration seconds used for informational purposes (currently derived from defaults and max).

`POST /realtor` requires `duration_seconds` explicitly.

lease_rate_max_leases.description: Rate limit: max leases in window.

lease_rate_remaining.description: Rate limit: remaining leases in window (if reported by indexer).

lease_rate_window_seconds.description: Rate limit: window size in seconds.

max_duration_seconds.description:
Maximum allowed lease duration in seconds.

If 0, no max is enforced by this service.

min_fee_ppm.description: Minimum lease fee PPM configured on hub for this realtor.

min_flat_fee.description: Minimum flat fee configured on hub for this realtor.

realtor_address.description: Address that identifies this realtor (the configured hub Safe).

supported_pairs.description: Supported (target_chain_id,target_token) pairs from the current bridger routing table.

untron_v3.description: UntronV3 contract address on hub chain.

user.description: Optional upstream principal/user identifier echoed from `x-untron-principal-id`.

effective_fee_ppm.description: Effective lease fee in PPM for this pair (currently not pair-specific).

effective_flat_fee.description:
Effective flat fee for this pair including any env-configured per-pair additional flat fee.

Does not include `arbitrary_lessee_flat_fee` (which depends on the request).

target_token.description: Target settlement token (EVM address on hub chain).

signature.description:
EIP-712 signature bytes (0x hex).

Typically a 65-byte ECDSA signature for EOAs; contract lessees may use ERC-1271 signatures.

target_token.description: Target settlement token (EVM address on hub chain).

valid_from_seq.description:
Controller event sequence at which this executor became current

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

Controller event sequence at which this LP became current

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

controller_lp_exchange_rates.description:
Current LP exchange rates for non-USDT tokens (KV)

Used by controller sweeps to compute USDT-equivalent amounts.

exchange_rate.description:
Scaled exchange rate used to convert token amounts into USDT-equivalent
amounts

token.description:
Token address on Tron whose exchange rate is configured

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

valid_from_seq.description:
Controller event sequence at which this exchange rate became current

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

event_seq.description:
Controller event sequence for this LP withdrawal

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

valid_from_seq.description:
Controller event sequence at which this owner became current

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

controller_payloads.description:
Current controller rebalancer payloads (KV)

Payloads configure how USDT is bridged out of Tron for each rebalancer implementation.

payload.description: Rebalancer-specific payload bytes (0x hex) used for delegatecall bridging

rebalancer.description:
Rebalancer address (Tron)

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

valid_from_seq.description:
Controller event sequence at which this payload became current

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

controller_pulled_from_receiver.description:
Controller sweep ledger (append-only)

Records each receiver sweep and the computed USDT-equivalent amount.

event_seq.description:
Controller event sequence for this receiver pull

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

exchange_rate.description: Exchange rate used (1e18-scaled); 1:1 for USDT sweeps

receiver_salt.description: Receiver salt identifying which deterministic receiver was swept

usdt_amount.description: USDT-equivalent amount accounted for this pull (uint256)

controller_receivers.description: Current mapping of receiver salts to deployed receiver addresses (KV)

receiver_salt.description:
Receiver salt (bytes32) identifying the deterministic receiver

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

valid_from_seq.description:
Controller event sequence at which this receiver mapping became current

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

controller_tip_proofs.description:
Controller tip proof logs (IsEventChainTipCalled)

On Tron, the controller exposes `isEventChainTip(bytes32)` which emits `IsEventChainTipCalled`.
This event is NOT appended into the controller's hash chain; it is used as a proof-carrying log to
anchor controller event sequences.

This view filters to `canonical=true` only.

block_hash.description: Block hash of the log's block (bytes32 hex)

block_number.description: Block number containing the controller `IsEventChainTipCalled` log

block_timestamp.description: Block timestamp (seconds since epoch) containing the log

log_index.description: Log index within the transaction receipt (0-based)

proved_tip.description:
Hash-chain tip value that the caller asserted as the controller's current
tip

tx_hash.description: Transaction hash of the transaction containing the log (bytes32 hex)

usdt.description: Controller canonical USDT token contract (Tron address)

valid_from_seq.description:
Controller event sequence at which this canonical USDT became current

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

event_seq.description:
Controller event sequence for this rebalance

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

out_amount.description: Expected USDT amount out on destination (uint256)

event_seq.description:
Controller event sequence for this executor transfer

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

recipient.description: Recipient of USDT from controller (Tron address)

event_appended.description:
Canonical raw EventAppended stream (both hub + controller)

This is the canonical ordered stream of Untron "semantic events", as emitted by the onchain index contracts.
Each row corresponds to one onchain `EventAppended` log and includes:
- hash-chain linkage (prev_tip/new_tip/event_seq)
- the semantic event name (`event_type`) and decoded arguments (`args`)
- block/tx metadata for auditability

This view filters to `canonical=true` only.

abi_encoded_event_data.description: Exact ABI-encoded event payload bytes that were hashed onchain (0x hex)

args.description:
Worker-decoded event arguments as JSON (snake_case keys; values as
strings/hex)

block_hash.description: Block hash of the log's block (bytes32 hex)

block_number.description: Block number containing the EventAppended log

block_timestamp.description: Block timestamp (seconds since epoch) containing the EventAppended log

event_seq.description: Monotonic sequence number in the stream's onchain event hash-chain

event_signature.description: Keccak256 hash of the semantic event signature string (bytes32 hex)

log_index.description: Log index within the transaction receipt (0-based)

new_tip.description: New onchain event hash-chain tip after this event

prev_tip.description: Previous onchain event hash-chain tip before this event

stream.description: Which stream emitted this EventAppended log (`hub` or `controller`)

tx_hash.description: Transaction hash of the log's transaction (bytes32 hex)

health.description:
Health check endpoint

Always returns a single row with `status = 'ok'` if PostgREST can query the database.

hub_bridgers.description:
Current bridger routing table (KV)

If a claim targets a different chain than the hub chain, the configured bridger is used to deliver funds.

target_chain_id.description:
Destination EVM chainId

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

target_token.description:
Token being bridged (EVM on hub chain)

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

valid_from_seq.description:
Event sequence at which this bridger route became current

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

hub_chains.description:
Current chain deprecation flags (KV)

Deprecated destination chains cannot be selected in new payout configs.

deprecated.description: Whether this destination chain is deprecated for new payout configs

target_chain_id.description:
Destination EVM chainId

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

valid_from_seq.description:
Event sequence at which this deprecation flag became current

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

hub_claims.description:
Current claim states (KV)

Claims are created by proven Tron deposits / LP-sponsored subjective pre-entitlement / controller profit volume,
and transition to `filled` when a filler settles them.

amount_usdt.description: USDT-denominated claim amount (uint256) used for accounting

claim_id.description:
Per-lease claim id (uint256, 0-indexed)

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

lease_id.description:
Lease id that produced this claim

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

origin_actor.description: Origin actor (e.g. subjective pre-entitle sponsor; otherwise zero)

origin_id.description:
Origin identifier (txId for pre-entitle, receiver_salt for receiver pull,
etc.)

origin_timestamp.description:
Origin timestamp (seconds) (Tron block time or controller dump time; 0 if
not applicable)

origin_token.description: Origin token/address (Tron token for receiver pull; zero address otherwise)

queue_index.description: Index in the FIFO queue (per target_token) where this claim was enqueued

target_chain_id.description: Destination chainId for payout (local if equals hub chainId)

target_token.description: Token used for settlement when filling this claim (EVM on hub chain)

valid_from_seq.description:
Event sequence at which this claim version became current

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

hub_controller_processed.description:
Hub-side controller processed events ledger (append-only)

Records that the hub processed a queued controller event during reconciliation.

block_number.description: Controller event block number (as embedded in the hub event payload)

block_timestamp.description:
Controller event block timestamp (seconds) (as embedded in the hub event
payload)

event_index.description: Index within the hub's controller event queue that was processed

event_seq.description:
Hub event sequence for this controller processing record

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

hub_controller_state.description:
Hub controller sync state (materialized)

This single-row view is a DB projection of hub events and is intended to replace hub
read-RPC calls:

- `last_controller_event_tip` == UntronV3Base.lastControllerEventTip()
- `last_controller_event_seq` == UntronV3Base.lastControllerEventSeq()
- `next_controller_event_index` == UntronV3Base.nextControllerEventIndex()

Values reflect the hub's canonical event stream as applied by the indexer.

valid_from_seq.description:
Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

hub_controller_tip_updates.description:
Hub-side controller tip update ledger (append-only)

Records the raw controller event bytes that were hash-linked into the controller tip as seen by the hub.

block_number.description: Controller event block number (as embedded in the hub event payload)

block_timestamp.description:
Controller event block timestamp (seconds) (as embedded in the hub event
payload)

event_seq.description:
Hub event sequence for this controller tip update record

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

previous_tip.description: Controller tip that this hop links from

hub_lease_nonces.description:
Current per-lease nonces (KV)

Used for replay protection on EIP-712 signature-based payout config updates.

lease_id.description:
Lease id

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

nonce.description: Current nonce value used for EIP-712 signature replay protection

valid_from_seq.description:
Event sequence at which this nonce became current

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

hub_leases.description:
Current lease registry (KV)

Leases define who controls payouts (lessee), which receiver salt they apply to, and fee schedule parameters.

flat_fee.description: Flat fee (USDT units) applied after percentage fee

lease_fee_ppm.description: Percentage fee (ppm) applied to recognized raw volume

lease_id.description:
Global lease id (uint256)

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

lease_number.description: Per-receiver lease index (0-based) for timeline ordering

nukeable_after.description:
Earliest timestamp when the lease can be replaced by a new one for this
receiver_salt

receiver_salt.description:
Receiver salt (bytes32) used to derive deterministic Tron receiver
addresses

start_time.description: Lease start time on the hub chain (seconds)

valid_from_seq.description:
Event sequence at which this lease became current

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

hub_lp_allowlist.description:
Current LP allowlist (KV)

LPs must be allowlisted to deposit principal into the hub fast-fill vault.

allowed.description:
Whether this LP may deposit into the fast-fill vault (withdrawals are always
allowed)

lp.description:
LP address (EVM)

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

valid_from_seq.description:
Event sequence at which this allowlist entry became current

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

hub_lp_balances.description:
Current derived LP principal balances (KV)

Derived deterministically from hub `LpDeposited`/`LpWithdrawn` events.

balance.description: Derived LP principal balance (uint256), based on deposits/withdrawals

lp.description:
LP address (EVM)

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

valid_from_seq.description:
Event sequence at which this balance snapshot became current

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

event_seq.description:
Hub event sequence for this vault event

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

hub_ownership.description:
Current hub owner (singleton)

Derived from `OwnershipTransferred` events emitted via `UntronV3Index`.

valid_from_seq.description:
Event sequence at which this owner transition became current

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

hub_payout_configs.description:
Current payout configuration per lease (KV)

Defines destination chain, settlement token, and beneficiary for newly created claims under each lease.

lease_id.description:
Lease id this payout config applies to

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

target_chain_id.description: Destination chainId for payouts created under this config

target_token.description:
Settlement token on the hub chain used for fills (USDT or swapped
token)

valid_from_seq.description:
Event sequence at which this payout config became current

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

hub_protocol_config.description:
Current hub protocol configuration (singleton)

Derived from a set of hub config events (USDT, Tron reader, fee floors, rate limits).

floor_flat_fee.description: Protocol-wide minimum flat fee floor (USDT units)

lessee_rate_max_updates.description:
Max payout config updates allowed per window per lessee (NULL/0 means
disabled)

lessee_rate_window_seconds.description:
Window size (seconds) for payout config update rate limiting (NULL/0 means
disabled)

max_lease_duration_seconds.description: Protocol-wide maximum lease duration in seconds (NULL/0 means disabled)

tron_reader.description:
EVM address (on the hub chain) of the trusted Tron transaction reader contract
used to verify + decode Tron transactions

tron_usdt.description: Tron USDT TRC-20 contract address (base58) accepted by `preEntitle`

usdt.description: EVM USDT accounting token address on the hub chain

valid_from_seq.description:
Event sequence at which this config snapshot became current

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

hub_protocol_pnl.description:
Current protocol PnL snapshot (singleton)

Tracks fee revenue and rebalance/withdrawal deltas as emitted by the hub contract.

valid_from_seq.description:
Event sequence at which this PnL snapshot became current

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

hub_realtors.description:
Current realtor allowlist + realtor config (KV)

Realtors are addresses allowed to create leases on the hub (`UntronV3.createLease`).

allowed.description: Whether this address is currently allowlisted to create leases

lease_rate_max_leases.description: Max lease creations allowed per window (NULL/0 means disabled)

lease_rate_window_seconds.description:
Window size (seconds) for lease creation rate limiting (NULL/0 means
disabled)

max_lease_duration_seconds.description: Realtor-specific maximum lease duration in seconds (NULL means no override)

min_flat_fee.description: Realtor-specific minimum flat fee floor (USDT units)

realtor.description:
Realtor address (EVM)

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

valid_from_seq.description:
Event sequence at which this realtor snapshot became current

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

hub_swap_rates.description:
Current swap rates for settlement tokens (KV)

Rates are used by fillers to swap USDT into the target token during claim settlement.

rate_ppm.description: Expected output rate: targetToken units per 1e6 USDT units

target_token.description:
Settlement token (EVM) on the hub chain

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

valid_from_seq.description:
Event sequence at which this rate became current

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

event_seq.description:
Hub event sequence for this rescue

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

token.description: Token rescued (EVM address on hub chain; must not be USDT)

lease_view.description:
Aggregated lease view (single-row per lease_id).

This view joins:
- current hub lease (hub.lease_versions)
- current payout config (hub.payout_config_versions)
- payout config history (hub.payout_config_versions, all versions)
- current per-lease nonce (hub.lease_nonce_versions)
- current claim states (hub.claim_versions)

It is intended for clients that want a single PostgREST request to fetch a full
lease "detail" payload.

realtor_effective_config.description:
Realtor effective config
(protocol floors + realtor overrides + rate remaining).

This view merges the protocol-wide floor limits with the current realtor row and returns:
- `allowed`
- `min_fee_ppm`, `min_flat_fee`, `max_duration_seconds` (effective minima/maxima)
- `lease_rate_*` and `lease_rate_remaining` (best-effort, computed from current leases within the window)

receiver_salt_candidates.description:
Receiver salt candidates for realtor selection.

Joins:
- `api.controller_receivers` (allowed salts)
- `api.receiver_usdt_balances` (cached balance view)
- latest hub lease by receiver_salt (for `nukeable_after`)

Computed fields:
- `has_balance`: `balance_amount > 0`
- `is_free`: receiver has no current lease or lease is nukeable (based on `nukeable_after <= now`)

receiver_usdt_balances.description:
Net receiver USDT balances derived from indexed transfer logs and pull
ledgers.

This is a deterministic approximation of each receiver's USDT balance:
  sum(incoming TRC-20 transfers into the receiver) - sum(controller pulls from that receiver)

It assumes receiver addresses do not have other outflows besides controller pulls.

receiver_salt.description:
Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

receiver_usdt_indexer_status.description:
Receiver USDT transfer indexer status (tail + backfill).

The TRC-20 receiver transfer indexer has two moving parts:
- a single shared tail cursor (`ctl.receiver_usdt_tail_cursor.next_block`), and
- per-receiver backfill cursors (`ctl.receiver_watchlist.backfill_next_block`).

Relayers should generally avoid acting on receiver-transfer-derived state unless:
- `min_backfill_next_block` is NULL (no pending backfills), and
- `tail_next_block` is close to the Tron head (with the relayer's own head check).

stream.description:
Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

receiver_usdt_transfer_actionability.description:
Receiver USDT deposits + actionability hints (preEntitle vs pull)

For each canonical TRC-20 USDT transfer into a deterministic receiver, this view shows:
- whether the hub has already accounted for it (matching claim origin_id == tx_hash),
- the latest observed receiver pull timestamp for (receiver_salt, token), and
- whether `preEntitle` is still time-eligible (`transfer_ts > last_pull_ts`).

`recommended_action` is a best-effort operator hint:
- 'already_accounted' => hub claim exists (origin pre-entitle or subjective pre-entitle)
- 'pre_entitle'        => no claim yet and pre-entitle timing is still allowed
- 'pull'               => no claim yet and a later pull timestamp suggests pre-entitle would revert

relayer_hub_state.description:
Relayer hub state bundle

Convenience single-row view combining:
- api.hub_controller_state

Intended for relayer use to minimize HTTP round trips.

stream_cursor.description:
Projection cursors (per stream)

Shows how far the database has applied canonical events to derived state tables.

Fields:
- `applied_through_seq`: highest contiguous canonical event_seq applied
- `tip`: expected prev_tip for the next event
- `updated_at`: last time the cursor advanced/rolled back

applied_through_seq.description:
Highest contiguous canonical event sequence already applied to derived
tables

stream.description:
Stream name (`hub` or `controller`)

Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

tip.description:
Expected `prev_tip` for the next event to apply (hash-chain continuity
check)

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the cursor last advanced or rolled back

stream_ingest_summary.description:
Per-stream ingestion/projection summary for relayers.

This view is intentionally minimal:
- It does NOT attempt to query RPC head (that stays in the relayer).
- It DOES let relayers detect when projections are behind ingestion (`is_projection_caught_up = false`),
  which would make derived "current state" views stale.

stream.description:
Note:
This is a Primary Key.<pk/>

unaccounted_receiver_usdt_transfers.description:
Unaccounted receiver USDT deposits

Tron TRC-20 Transfer logs not yet reflected as hub claims

Rows in this view correspond to canonical TRC-20 USDT transfers into
deterministic receivers that do NOT yet have a hub-side claim with
`origin in (pre-entitle, subjective pre-entitle)` matching
`origin_id = tx_hash`.

This view is intended for operators to identify deposits that may require
action (preEntitle or receiver pull).

get.description:
On Tron, the controller exposes `isEventChainTip(bytes32)` which emits `IsEventChainTipCalled`.
This event is NOT appended into the controller's hash chain; it is used as a proof-carrying log to
anchor controller event sequences.

This view filters to `canonical=true` only.

parameters.description: Block number containing the controller `IsEventChainTipCalled` log
parameters.name: block_number

parameters.description: Block timestamp (seconds since epoch) containing the log
parameters.name: block_timestamp

parameters.description: Block hash of the log's block (bytes32 hex)
parameters.name: block_hash

parameters.description: Transaction hash of the transaction containing the log (bytes32 hex)
parameters.name: tx_hash

parameters.description: Log index within the transaction receipt (0-based)
parameters.name: log_index

parameters.description:
Hash-chain tip value that the caller asserted as the controller's current
tip
parameters.name: proved_tip

parameters.description: Controller event sequence at which this canonical USDT became current
parameters.name: valid_from_seq

parameters.description: Controller canonical USDT token contract (Tron address)
parameters.name: usdt

parameters.description: Controller event sequence for this rebalance
parameters.name: event_seq

parameters.description: Expected USDT amount out on destination (uint256)
parameters.name: out_amount

parameters.description: Controller event sequence for this executor transfer
parameters.name: event_seq

parameters.description: Recipient of USDT from controller (Tron address)
parameters.name: recipient

get.description:
This is the canonical ordered stream of Untron "semantic events", as emitted by the onchain index contracts.
Each row corresponds to one onchain `EventAppended` log and includes:
- hash-chain linkage (prev_tip/new_tip/event_seq)
- the semantic event name (`event_type`) and decoded arguments (`args`)
- block/tx metadata for auditability

This view filters to `canonical=true` only.

parameters.description: Which stream emitted this EventAppended log (`hub` or `controller`)
parameters.name: stream

parameters.description: Monotonic sequence number in the stream's onchain event hash-chain
parameters.name: event_seq

parameters.description: Previous onchain event hash-chain tip before this event
parameters.name: prev_tip

parameters.description: New onchain event hash-chain tip after this event
parameters.name: new_tip

parameters.description: Keccak256 hash of the semantic event signature string (bytes32 hex)
parameters.name: event_signature

parameters.description: Exact ABI-encoded event payload bytes that were hashed onchain (0x hex)
parameters.name: abi_encoded_event_data

parameters.description:
Worker-decoded event arguments as JSON (snake_case keys; values as
strings/hex)
parameters.name: args

parameters.description: Block number containing the EventAppended log
parameters.name: block_number

parameters.description: Block timestamp (seconds since epoch) containing the EventAppended log
parameters.name: block_timestamp

parameters.description: Block hash of the log's block (bytes32 hex)
parameters.name: block_hash

parameters.description: Transaction hash of the log's transaction (bytes32 hex)
parameters.name: tx_hash

parameters.description: Log index within the transaction receipt (0-based)
parameters.name: log_index

get.summary: Canonical raw EventAppended stream (both hub + controller)

get.description:
This view joins:
- current hub lease (hub.lease_versions)
- current payout config (hub.payout_config_versions)
- payout config history (hub.payout_config_versions, all versions)
- current per-lease nonce (hub.lease_nonce_versions)
- current claim states (hub.claim_versions)

It is intended for clients that want a single PostgREST request to fetch a full
lease "detail" payload.

parameters.description: Either a global lease ID (decimal u64) or a receiver salt (bytes32 hex)
parameters.name: lease_id

post.summary: Create an address lease in Untron V3 protocol.

get.description:
(protocol floors + realtor overrides + rate remaining).

This view merges the protocol-wide floor limits with the current realtor row and returns:
- `allowed`
- `min_fee_ppm`, `min_flat_fee`, `max_duration_seconds` (effective minima/maxima)
- `lease_rate_*` and `lease_rate_remaining` (best-effort, computed from current leases within the window)

Joins:
- `api.controller_receivers` (allowed salts)
- `api.receiver_usdt_balances` (cached balance view)
- latest hub lease by receiver_salt (for `nukeable_after`)

Computed fields:
- `has_balance`: `balance_amount > 0`
- `is_free`: receiver has no current lease or lease is nukeable (based on `nukeable_after <= now`)
get.summary: Receiver salt candidates for realtor selection.

get.description:
ledgers.

This is a deterministic approximation of each receiver's USDT balance:
  sum(incoming TRC-20 transfers into the receiver) - sum(controller pulls from that receiver)

It assumes receiver addresses do not have other outflows besides controller pulls.
get.summary: Net receiver USDT balances derived from indexed transfer logs and pull

get.description:
The TRC-20 receiver transfer indexer has two moving parts:
- a single shared tail cursor (`ctl.receiver_usdt_tail_cursor.next_block`), and
- per-receiver backfill cursors (`ctl.receiver_watchlist.backfill_next_block`).

Relayers should generally avoid acting on receiver-transfer-derived state unless:
- `min_backfill_next_block` is NULL (no pending backfills), and
- `tail_next_block` is close to the Tron head (with the relayer's own head check).
get.summary: Receiver USDT transfer indexer status (tail + backfill).

get.description:
For each canonical TRC-20 USDT transfer into a deterministic receiver, this view shows:
- whether the hub has already accounted for it (matching claim origin_id == tx_hash),
- the latest observed receiver pull timestamp for (receiver_salt, token), and
- whether `preEntitle` is still time-eligible (`transfer_ts > last_pull_ts`).

`recommended_action` is a best-effort operator hint:
- 'already_accounted' => hub claim exists (origin pre-entitle or subjective pre-entitle)
- 'pre_entitle'        => no claim yet and pre-entitle timing is still allowed
- 'pull'               => no claim yet and a later pull timestamp suggests pre-entitle would revert
get.summary: Receiver USDT deposits + actionability hints (preEntitle vs pull)

get.description:
Convenience single-row view combining:
- api.hub_controller_state

Intended for relayer use to minimize HTTP round trips.

Shows how far the database has applied canonical events to derived state tables.

Fields:
- `applied_through_seq`: highest contiguous canonical event_seq applied
- `tip`: expected prev_tip for the next event
- `updated_at`: last time the cursor advanced/rolled back

parameters.description:
Highest contiguous canonical event sequence already applied to derived
tables
parameters.name: applied_through_seq

parameters.description:
Expected `prev_tip` for the next event to apply (hash-chain continuity
check)
parameters.name: tip

parameters.description: Timestamp when the cursor last advanced or rolled back
parameters.name: updated_at

get.description:
This view is intentionally minimal:
- It does NOT attempt to query RPC head (that stays in the relayer).
- It DOES let relayers detect when projections are behind ingestion (`is_projection_caught_up = false`),
  which would make derived "current state" views stale.

Tron TRC-20 Transfer logs not yet reflected as hub claims

Rows in this view correspond to canonical TRC-20 USDT transfers into
deterministic receivers that do NOT yet have a hub-side claim with
`origin in (pre-entitle, subjective pre-entitle)` matching
`origin_id = tx_hash`.

This view is intended for operators to identify deposits that may require
action (preEntitle or receiver pull).
